reactions.name: Methane Combustion
reactions.description: Complete combustion of methane in oxygen to produce carbon dioxide and water.
reactions.details: This is an exothermic reaction that releases heat. Methane reacts with oxygen to form carbon dioxide and water vapor.
reactions.conditions: Presence of oxygen and ignition source
reactions.safety: Produces heat and can cause fires. Ensure proper ventilation.
steps: New C=O bonds form to make CO₂
New O-H bonds form to make H₂O
reactions.mechanism: Free radical chain reaction involving initiation, propagation, and termination steps.

reactions.name: Ethene Hydrogenation
reactions.description: Addition of hydrogen to ethene to form ethane using a catalyst.
reactions.details: This reaction adds hydrogen across the double bond of ethene, saturating it to form ethane.
reactions.safety: Hydrogen is flammable. Use proper catalyst handling procedures.
